```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_smd <- function(data, group_var, vars) {
    # Ensure that the group_var is a factor
    group_var <- factor(data[[group_var]])
    
    # Ensure that there are exactly two levels in the group variable
    if (nlevels(group_var) != 2) {
        stop("The group variable must have exactly two levels.")
    }
    
    # Initialize a list to store SMDs for each variable
    smd_list <- list()
    
    # Iterate over the variables for which SMD needs to be calculated
    for (var in vars) {
        # Extract the variable
        variable <- data[[var]]
        
        # Check if the variable is continuous or categorical
        if (is.numeric(variable)) {
            # Calculate SMD for continuous variable
            smd_value <- smd_continuous(variable, group_var)
        } else if (is.factor(variable) || is.logical(variable)) {
            # Calculate SMD for categorical variable
            smd_value <- smd_categorical(variable, group_var)
        } else {
            warning(paste("Variable", var, "is not supported for SMD calculation."))
            smd_value <- NA
        }
        
        # Store the SMD value
        smd_list[[var]] <- smd_value
    }
    
    return(smd_list)
}

# Function to calculate SMD for continuous variables
smd_continuous <- function(variable, group_var) {
    # Split the variable by the group
    group1 <- variable[group_var == levels(group_var)[1]]
    group2 <- variable[group_var == levels(group_var)[2]]
    
    # Calculate means and pooled standard deviation
    mean1 <- mean(group1, na.rm = TRUE)
    mean2 <- mean(group2, na.rm = TRUE)
    sd1 <- sd(group1, na.rm = TRUE)
    sd2 <- sd(group2, na.rm = TRUE)
    
    pooled_sd <- sqrt((sd1^2 + sd2^2) / 2)
    
    # Calculate SMD
    smd <- (mean1 - mean2) / pooled_sd
    return(smd)
}

# Function to calculate SMD for categorical variables (binary or factor)
smd_categorical <- function(variable, group_var) {
    # Create a contingency table
    table_data <- table(variable, group_var)
    
    # Ensure that there are two groups in the variable
    if (nrow(table_data) != 2) {
        stop("Categorical variable must have exactly two levels for SMD calculation.")
    }
    
    # Calculate proportions in both groups
    prop1 <- prop.table(table_data[, 1])
    prop2 <- prop.table(table_data[, 2])
    
    # Calculate pooled proportion
    pooled_prop <- (prop1 + prop2) / 2
    
    # Calculate SMD
    smd <- (prop1 - prop2) / sqrt(pooled_prop * (1 - pooled_prop))
    return(smd)
}
```

```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
# Improved Function to calculate SMD for a list of variables
calculate_smd <- function(data, group_var, vars) {
    # Ensure that the group_var is a factor with exactly two levels
    group_var <- factor(data[[group_var]])
    
    if (nlevels(group_var) != 2) {
        stop("The group variable must have exactly two levels.")
    }
    
    # Initialize a data frame to store SMD results
    smd_df <- data.frame(
        variable = character(),
        smd_value = numeric(),
        variable_type = character(),
        stringsAsFactors = FALSE
    )
    
    # Iterate over the variables for which SMD needs to be calculated
    for (var in vars) {
        # Extract the variable
        variable <- data[[var]]
        
        # Check if the variable is continuous or categorical
        if (is.numeric(variable)) {
            # Calculate SMD for continuous variable
            smd_value <- smd_continuous(variable, group_var)
            smd_type <- "Continuous"
        } else if (is.factor(variable) || is.logical(variable)) {
            # Calculate SMD for categorical variable
            smd_value <- smd_categorical(variable, group_var)
            smd_type <- "Categorical"
        } else {
            warning(paste("Variable", var, "is not supported for SMD calculation."))
            smd_value <- NA
            smd_type <- "Unsupported"
        }
        
        # Append the result to the data frame
        smd_df <- rbind(smd_df, data.frame(variable = var, smd_value = smd_value, variable_type = smd_type))
    }
    
    return(smd_df)
}

# Improved function for continuous variables
smd_continuous <- function(variable, group_var) {
    # Split the variable by the group
    group1 <- variable[group_var == levels(group_var)[1]]
    group2 <- variable[group_var == levels(group_var)[2]]
    
    # Calculate means and pooled standard deviation
    mean1 <- mean(group1, na.rm = TRUE)
    mean2 <- mean(group2, na.rm = TRUE)
    sd1 <- sd(group1, na.rm = TRUE)
    sd2 <- sd(group2, na.rm = TRUE)
    
    pooled_sd <- sqrt((sd1^2 + sd2^2) / 2)
    
    # Handle case where pooled_sd is 0 (e.g., when the variable has no variance)
    if (pooled_sd == 0) {
        warning("Pooled standard deviation is zero, returning NA for SMD.")
        return(NA)
    }
    
    # Calculate SMD
    smd <- (mean1 - mean2) / pooled_sd
    return(smd)
}

# Improved function for categorical variables (binary or factor)
smd_categorical <- function(variable, group_var) {
    # Create a contingency table
    table_data <- table(variable, group_var)
    
    # Ensure that the categorical variable has two levels
    if (nrow(table_data) != 2) {
        stop("Categorical variable must have exactly two levels for SMD calculation.")
    }
    
    # Calculate proportions for both groups
    prop1 <- prop.table(table_data, 2)[, 1]
    prop2 <- prop.table(table_data, 2)[, 2]
    
    # Calculate pooled proportion
    pooled_prop <- (prop1 + prop2) / 2
    
    # Handle case where pooled proportion is 0 or 1 (i.e., no variance in proportion)
    if (any(pooled_prop == 0 | pooled_prop == 1)) {
        warning("Pooled proportion is 0 or 1, returning NA for SMD.")
        return(NA)
    }
    
    # Calculate SMD
    smd <- (prop1 - prop2) / sqrt(pooled_prop * (1 - pooled_prop))
    return(smd)
}
```

```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_smd <- function(variable, group, type = "pooled", na.rm = TRUE) {

  # Check if variables are appropriate
  if (!is.numeric(variable)) {
    stop("`variable` must be numeric.")
  }
  if (!is.factor(group) || nlevels(group) != 2) {
    stop("`group` must be a factor with two levels.")
  }

  # Remove missing values if specified
  if (na.rm) {
    complete_cases <- complete.cases(variable, group)
    variable <- variable[complete_cases]
    group <- group[complete_cases]
  }

  # Calculate group means and standard deviations
  means <- tapply(variable, group, mean)
  sds <- tapply(variable, group, sd)

  # Calculate SMD based on specified type
  if (type == "pooled") {
    # Pooled standard deviation
    pooled_sd <- sqrt(((length(variable[group == levels(group)[1]]) - 1) * sds[1]^2 +
                         (length(variable[group == levels(group)[2]]) - 1) * sds[2]^2) /
                        (length(variable) - 2))
    smd <- (means[1] - means[2]) / pooled_sd
  } else if (type == "control") {
    # Control group standard deviation
    smd <- (means[1] - means[2]) / sds[1]  # Assuming first level is control
  } else {
    stop("Invalid `type` argument. Must be 'pooled' or 'control'.")
  }

  return(smd)
}
```

```{r, echo=TRUE, results="markup", collapse=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, comment="#", R.options=list(width=120)}
options(width=120)
calculate_smd <- function(variable, group, type = c("continuous", "categorical")) {

  # Check input types
  if (!is.numeric(variable) && type == "continuous") {
    stop("Variable must be numeric for continuous SMD calculation.")
  }
  if (!is.factor(group)) {
    stop("Group must be a factor.")
  }

  type <- match.arg(type)

  if (type == "continuous") {
    # Calculate SMD for continuous variables
    means <- tapply(variable, group, mean, na.rm = TRUE)
    vars <- tapply(variable, group, var, na.rm = TRUE)
    ns <- tapply(variable, group, function(x) sum(!is.na(x)))
    
    pooled_sd <- sqrt(sum((ns - 1) * vars) / (sum(ns) - length(ns)))
    smd <- (means[1] - means[2]) / pooled_sd
    
  } else if (type == "categorical") {
    # Calculate SMD for categorical variables (using Mahalanobis distance)
    
    # Convert the categorical variable to a set of dummy variables
    dummy_vars <- model.matrix(~ 0 + variable)
    
    # Calculate the group means and covariance matrix
    means <- aggregate(dummy_vars, by = list(group), FUN = mean, na.rm = TRUE)[-1]
    cov_matrix <- cov(dummy_vars, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")
    
    # Calculate the Mahalanobis distance
    inv_cov_matrix <- solve(cov_matrix)
    diff_means <- as.matrix(means[1, ] - means[2, ])
    mahalanobis_dist <- sqrt(t(diff_means) %*% inv_cov_matrix %*% diff_means)
    
    smd <- mahalanobis_dist
  }

  return(smd)
}
```
